form.longName: PhenX PX040301 - Blood Pressure Adult Primary
form.preferredDefinition: A measure to assess a respondent's systolic and diastolic blood pressure, which is used to determine high blood pressure (hypertension). Assessment must also include measures for personal history of high blood pressure and a history of medication usage.

question.questionText: Has a doctor or nurse ever said that you have high blood pressure or hypertension? (ever_have_high_blood_pressure)
At what age were you first told this? (age_have_high_blood_pressure)
FOR WOMEN: Was this during pregnancy only? (hbp_during_pregnancy_only)
Have you ever taken medication for hypertension/high blood pressure? (ever_take_hbp_medication)
At what age did you begin taking medicine for this? (age_take_hbp_medication)
At what age did you begin taking medicine for this? (age_take_hbp_medication_coded)
Blood pressure measurement, sphygmomanometer name and model. (sphygmomanometer)
Cuff size image (cardio_003_image002)
Blood pressure measurement, cuff size. (cuff_size)
Wrapping blood pressure cuff image (cardio_003_image004)
Locating brachial artery image (cardio_003_image006)
Securing cuff firmly image (cardio_003_image008)
AC adapter plugged in image (cardio_003_image010)
Turn ON/Off button to on image (cardio_003_image012)
Set the MODE selector image (cardio_003_image014)
Set the PSET (inflation level) image (cardio_003_image016)
Connect the air image (cardio_003_image018)
Taking measurements image (cardio_003_image020)
Systolic Pressure measurement 1 (mm Hg). (systolic_blood_pressure_1)
Diastolic Pressure measurement 1 (mm Hg). (diastolic_blood_pressure_1)
Systolic Pressure measurement 2 (mm Hg). (systolic_blood_pressure_2)
Diastolic Pressure measurement 2 (mm Hg). (diastolic_blood_pressure_2)
Systolic Pressure measurement 3 (mm Hg). (systolic_blood_pressure_3)
Diastolic Pressure measurement 3 (mm Hg). (diastolic_blood_pressure_3)
Date of measurement of blood pressure. (blood_pressure_measurement_date)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A measure to assess a respondent's systolic and diastolic blood pressure, which is used to determine high blood pressure (hypertension). Assessment must also include measures for personal history of high blood pressure and a history of medication usage.

form.longName: PhenX PX040101 - Family History Of Heart Attack
form.preferredDefinition: This measure assesses if the respondent's biological parents, siblings, and children have had a heart attack.

question.questionText: Did your mother, father, fullblooded sisters, fullblooded brothers, daughters, or sons ever have a heart attack or myocardial infarction? (family_ever_have_heart_attack)

For these questions, please think about fullblooded relatives only. Do not think about halfsisters or halfbrothers, or relatives who are related to you by marriage or adoption. Fullblooded sisters and brothers are those who had the same two parents as you. If you are adopted or are not sure about some relatives' health history, please include any family history that you know about. (instruction1)
Did your mom, dad, siblings, kids have heart attack? (var1)
Did your mother have a heart attack? (mother_heart_attack_history)

validValue.meaningText: Yes. Less than 55 when the first heart attack occurred
validValue.description: Yes. Less than 55 when the first heart attack occurred

validValue.meaningText: Yes. 55-64 when the first heart attack occurred
validValue.description: Yes. 55-64 when the first heart attack occurred

validValue.meaningText: Yes. 65 or older when the first heart attack occurred
validValue.description: Yes. 65 or older when the first heart attack occurred

validValue.meaningText: Yes. Don't know age when the first heart attack occurred
validValue.description: Yes. Don't know age when the first heart attack occurred

validValue.meaningText: Don't know if she had a heart attack
validValue.description: Don't know if she had a heart attack

form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's 30-day frequency of use of drugs.

question.questionText: Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use sedatives? (frequency_sedatives)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use sedatives? (frequency_sedatives_coded)

Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use tranquilizers or antianxiety drugs? (frequency_tranquilizers)

Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use tranquilizers or antianxiety drugs? (frequency_tranquilizers_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use painkillers? (frequency_painkillers)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use painkillers? (frequency_painkillers_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use stimulants? (frequency_stimulants)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use stimulants? (frequency_stimulants_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use marijuana or hashish? (frequency_marijuana)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use marijuana or hashish? (frequency_marijuana_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use cocaine? (frequency_cocaine)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use cocaine? (frequency_cocaine_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use crack? (frequency_crack)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use crack? (frequency_crack_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any hallucinogens? (frequency_hallucinogens)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any hallucinogens? (frequency_hallucinogens_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any inhalant for kicks or to get high? (frequency_inhalant)

Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any inhalant for kicks or to get high? (frequency_inhalant_coded)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any heroin? (frequency_heroin)
Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any heroin? (frequency_heroin_coded)

Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any other medicines or drugs or substances? (frequency_other)

Think specifically about the past 30 days, from [DATEFILL] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use any other medicines or drugs or substances? (frequency_other_coded)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's 30-day frequency of use of drugs.

form.longName: PhenX PX040401 - High Blood Pressure During Pregnancy
form.preferredDefinition: A measure to assess high blood pressure during a current pregnancy.

question.questionText: Did you have (Have you had) any of these illnesses or complications during this pregnancy? Toxemia including all of the following: high blood pressure, albumin (protein) in urine, and swelling of the ankles? (toxemia_during_pregnancy)
Did you have (Have you had) any of these illnesses or complications during this pregnancy? High blood pressure without toxemia? (hbp_no_toxemia_during_pregnancy)

protocol.preferredDefinition: A measure to assess high blood pressure during a current pregnancy.

form.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess the structure and function of the valves within the heart to determine the presence of dysfunction.

question.questionText: Has a doctor ever told you that you had rheumatic heart disease or heart valve problems? (ever_have_heart_valve_problem)
Date of Electrocardiogram (ECG) Examination (mm/dd/yyyy). (ecg_examination_date)
Electrocardiogram Trace/Image ID. (ecg_image_id)
Classification of Severity of Valve Disease in Adults image (cardio_005_image002)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess the structure and function of the valves within the heart to determine the presence of dysfunction.

form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's lifetime use of illicit and prescribed substances.

question.questionText: Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Sedatives, for example, sleeping pills, barbiturates, Seconal, Quaaludes, or Chloral Hydrate Specify (lifetime_use_sedatives)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Tranquilizers or antianxiety drugs, for example, Valium, Librium, muscle relaxants, or Zanax Specify (lifetime_use_tranquilizers)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Painkillers, for example, Codeine, Darvon, Percodan, Oxycontin, Dilaudid, Demerol, Celebrex, or Vioxx Specify (lifetime_use_painkillers)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Stimulants, for example, Preludin, Benzedrine, Methedrine, Ritalin, uppers, or speed Specify (lifetime_use_stimulants)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Marijuana, hash, THC, or grass Specify (lifetime_use_marijuana)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Cocaine or crack Specify (lifetime_use_cocaine)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Hallucinogens, for example, Ecstasy/MDMA, LSD, mescaline, psilocybin, PCP, angel dust, or peyote Specify (lifetime_use_hallucinogens)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Inhalants or solvents, for example, amyl nitrite, nitrous oxide, glue, toluene or gasoline Specify (lifetime_use_inhalant)
Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Heroin (lifetime_use_heroin)

Have you EVER used any of these medicines or drugs? Any OTHER medicines, or drugs, or substances, for example, methadone, Elavil, steroids, Thorazine or Haldol? (SELECT MOST FREQUENTLY USED OTHER DRUG) (lifetime_use_other)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's lifetime use of illicit and prescribed substances.

form.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her personal history of angina and chest discomfort characteristics to determine presence of angina.

question.questionText: Has a doctor ever told you that you had angina? (have_angina)
Any chest discomfort ever/since last exam or medical history update? (chest_discomfort_since_lastexam)
Chest discomfort with exertion or excitement (chest_discomfort_exertion)
Chest discomfort when quiet or resting (chest_discomfort_quite)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Date of onset (mo) (chest_discomfort_onset_month)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Date of onset (mo) (chest_discomfort_onset_month_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Date of onset (yr) (chest_discomfort_onset_year)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Date of onset (yr) (chest_discomfort_onset_year_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Usual duration (minutes) (chest_discomfort_usual_duration_minute)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Usual duration (minutes) (chest_discomfort_usual_duration_minute_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Longest duration (minutes) (chest_discomfort_longest_duration_minute)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Longest duration (minutes) (chest_discomfort_longest_duration_minute_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Location (chest_discomfort_location)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Radiation (chest_discomfort_radiation)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Frequency (number in past month) (chest_discomfort_frequency_past_month)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Frequency (number in past month) (chest_discomfort_frequency_past_month_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Frequency (number in past year) (chest_discomfort_frequency_past_year)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Frequency (number in past year) (chest_discomfort_frequency_past_year_coded)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Type (chest_discomfort_type)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Relief by nitroglycerine in < 15 minutes (chest_discomfort_relief_nitroglycerine)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Relief by rest in < 15 minutes (chest_discomfort_relief_rest)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Relief spontaneously in < 15 minutes (chest_discomfort_relief_spontaneously)
Chest Discomfort Characteristics Relief by other cause in < 15 minutes (chest_discomfort_relief_other)
Since your last exam, have you been told by a doctor you had a heart attack? (heart_attack_since_lastexam)
CHD First Opinions Angina pectoris in interim (angina_pectoris_interim)
CHD First Opinions Angina pectoris since revascularization procedure (angina_pectoris_revascularization)
CHD First Opinions Coronary insufficiency in interim (coronary_insufficiency_interim)
CHD First Opinions Myocardial infarct in interim (myocardial_infarct_interim)
Comment (comments)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The interviewer asks the respondent about his/her personal history of angina and chest discomfort characteristics to determine presence of angina.

form.preferredDefinition: Measure of plasma lipid levels in blood samples to predict risk for the development of heart attack or to define metabolic syndrome.

headerInstruction.text: If the respondent answers "yes" to question 1, then the interviewer will proceed to question 2. The use of lipidlowering medications must be captured, as the use of medications can have profound and predictable effects on the lipid levels and ..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Has a doctor or nurse ever said that you have high blood cholesterol? (ever_have_high_blood_cholesterol)
Have you ever taken medication for high blood cholesterol? (ever_take_high_blood_cholesterol_medication)
At what age did you begin taking medicine for this? (age_take_high_blood_cholesterol_medication)
At what age did you begin taking medicine for this? (age_take_high_blood_cholesterol_medication_coded)
Interview: Was blood requested for lipid profile? (lipid_requested)
Interview: Was consent given? (lipid_consent)
Interview: Was blood drawn successfully? (lipid_blood_drawn)
Date blood drawn for lipid profile (mm/dd/yyyy) (lipid_date)
Time blood drawn for lipid profile (hh:mm am/pm) (lipid_time)
Total cholesterol from lipid profile (lipid_total_cholesterol)
LDL from lipid profile (lipid_ldl)
HDL from lipid profile (lipid_hdl)
Triglycerides from lipid profile (lipid_triglyceride)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measure of plasma lipid levels in blood samples to predict risk for the development of heart attack or to define metabolic syndrome.

form.preferredDefinition: This measure assesses if a patient died of sudden cardiac arrest by reviewing symptoms prior to death, timing of death, possible cardiac origin via autopsy evidence, and/or demonstration of a history of cardiac disease via physician questionnaire and medical records review.

headerInstruction.text: To be completed by physician who signed the death certificate and/or the patient's physician.

question.questionText: Are you familiar with the events surrounding the decedent's death? (physician_familiar_with_event)
Did you witness the death? (physician_witness_death)
Was there any pain in the chest, left arm or shoulder or jaw within 72 hours of death? (pain)
Did the pain include the chest? (pain_include_chest)
Did you think this pain was of a cardiac origin? (pain_cardiac_origin)
Did you think this pain was of a cardiac origin? If no, specify what you think was the cause. (pain_cardiac_origin_specify_cause)
Was cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and/or cardioversion performed within 24 hours of death? (cpr)
Please give time between onset of acute symptoms to death. (We are defining death as the point where spontaneous breathing ceased and the patient never recovered). (symptom_time)

validValue.meaningText: At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours
validValue.description: At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

validValue.meaningText: At least 4 hours, but less than 12 hours
validValue.description: At least 4 hours, but less than 12 hours

validValue.meaningText: At least 1 hour, but less than 4 hours
validValue.description: At least 1 hour, but less than 4 hours

question.questionText: Would you classify the decedent's cause of death as due to Coronary Heart Disease (CHD)? (chd)
Location of death (location)

validValue.meaningText: Emergency Room (not dead on arrival- DOA)
validValue.description: Emergency Room (not dead on arrival- DOA)

validValue.meaningText: Nursing Home, Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF), or Extended Care Facility (ECF)
validValue.description: Nursing Home, Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF), or Extended Care Facility (ECF)

question.questionText: Location of death (location_other_specify)
Was the death witnessed? (witness_record)
MultiEthnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) classification of underlying cause of death (choose one) (cause)

validValue.meaningText: Atherosclerotic disease other than coronary disease or stroke
validValue.description: Atherosclerotic disease other than coronary disease or stroke

validValue.meaningText: Other cardiovascular disease, not defined above
validValue.description: Other cardiovascular disease, not defined above

question.questionText: MultiEthnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) classification of underlying cause of death: Atherosclerotic disease other than coronary disease or stroke (specify) (cause_other_atherosclerotic_disease_specify)
MultiEthnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) classification of underlying cause of death: Other cardiovascular disease, not defined above (specify) (cause_other_cardiovascular_disease_specify)
MultiEthnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA) classification of underlying cause of death: Noncardiovascular disease (specify) (cause_noncardiovascular_disease_specify)
Type of fatal coronary heart disease. (fatal_chd_type)

validValue.meaningText: Definite fatal myocardial infarction (MI) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause and definite myocardial infarction within 4 weeks of death)
validValue.description: Definite fatal myocardial infarction (MI) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause and definite myocardial infarction within 4 weeks of death)

validValue.meaningText: Definite fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause, and one or both of the following: chest pain within 72 hours of death or a history of chronic ischemic heart disease)
validValue.description: Definite fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause, and one or both of the following: chest pain within 72 hours of death or a history of chronic ischemic heart disease)

validValue.meaningText: Possible fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause, and death certificate underlying cause: I20-25, I46, I51.6, R96 or R98-99)
validValue.description: Possible fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) (no known non-atherosclerotic cause, and death certificate underlying cause: I20-25, I46, I51.6, R96 or R98-99)

question.questionText: Estimated time between onset of acute cardiac symptoms and death. (symptom_time_estimated)
Mechanism of death in patients dying of cardiovascular causes (check all that apply). (mechanism)

validValue.meaningText: Cardiac procedure such as coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or angioplasty
validValue.description: Cardiac procedure such as coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or angioplasty

question.questionText: Mechanism of death in patients dying of cardiovascular causes (mechanism_other_specify)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This measure assesses if a patient died of sudden cardiac arrest by reviewing symptoms prior to death, timing of death, possible cardiac origin via autopsy evidence, and/or demonstration of a history of cardiac disease via physician questionnaire and medical records review.

form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's symptoms of cigarette dependence.

question.questionText: CURRENT SMOKER? (current_smoker)
Was there a 6month period when you smoked more than you do now? (current_smoker_more_enum)
Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers How soon after you wake up do/did you smoke your first cigarette? (current_smoker_1stsmoke_time)

Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers Do/Did you find it difficult to refrain from smoking in places where it is forbidden, e.g., in church, at the library, in a cinema, etc.? (current_smoker_refraining_difficulty)
Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers Which cigarette would you hate most to give up? (current_smoker_1stsmoke_givingup)

validValue.meaningText: The first one in the morning [1 point]
validValue.description: The first one in the morning [1 point]

question.questionText: Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers How many cigarettes per day do/did you smoke? (current_smoker_quantity_1day)
Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers Do/did you smoke more frequently during the first hours after waking than during the rest of the day? (current_smoker_more_1sthour)
Current EveryDay or Current SomeDay Smokers Do/did you smoke if you are so ill that you are in bed most of the day? (current_smoker_smoking_during_illness)
Former Smokers How soon after you wake up do/did you smoke your first cigarette? (former_smoker_1stsmoke_time)
Former Smokers Do/Did you find it difficult to refrain from smoking in places where it is forbidden, e.g., in church, at the library, in a cinema, etc.? (former_smoker_refraining_difficulty)
Former Smokers Which cigarette would you hate most to give up? (former_smoker_1stsmoke_givingup)

validValue.meaningText: The first one in the morning [1 point]
validValue.description: The first one in the morning [1 point]

question.questionText: Former Smokers How many cigarettes per day do/did you smoke? (former_smoker_quantity_1day)
Former Smokers Do/did you smoke more frequently during the first hours after waking than during the rest of the day? (former_smoker_more_1sthour)
Former Smokers Do/did you smoke if you are so ill that you are in bed most of the day? (former_smoker_smoking_during_illness)

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's symptoms of cigarette dependence.
